description:
Manages a Load Balancer NAT pool.

-> **NOTE:** This resource cannot be used with with virtual machines, instead use the `azurerm_lb_nat_rule` resource.

~> **NOTE** When using this resource, the Load Balancer needs to have a FrontEnd IP Configuration Attached

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

BackendPort.description: The port used for the internal endpoint. Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive.

FrontendIpConfigurationName.description: The name of the frontend IP configuration exposing this rule.

FrontendPortEnd.description: The last port number in the range of external ports that will be used to provide Inbound Nat to NICs associated with this Load Balancer. Possible values range between 1 and 65534, inclusive.

FrontendPortStart.description: The first port number in the range of external ports that will be used to provide Inbound Nat to NICs associated with this Load Balancer. Possible values range between 1 and 65534, inclusive.

LoadbalancerId.description: The ID of the Load Balancer in which to create the NAT pool.

Name.description: Specifies the name of the NAT pool.

Protocol.description: The transport protocol for the external endpoint. Possible values are `Udp` or `Tcp`.

ResourceGroupName.description: The name of the resource group in which to create the resource.
